subject: Re: AW: AW: [junit] get Message "Could not invoke the suite()	method" fr om JUnit Testrunner
msgSnippet: I will take a look today at the files. On Sun, 2003-03-09 at 15:43, J. B. Rainsberger wrote: Some general comments. 1. There is never ever a reason to call new
messageBody:
I will take a look today at the files.

On Sun, 2003-03-09 at 15:43, J. B. Rainsberger wrote: Some general
comments.

1. There is never ever a reason to call new String("literal string").
Ever. Please replace those calls with just "literal string".
2. Make the indentation of this code consistent, please. I cannot even
begin to read it.
3. Don't use the method name "test". It doesn't mean anything and could
confuse the TestRunner.

I just don't understand at all what your suite() method is trying to do.
It seems to add some number of copies of the same test method to the
suite, which looks to me to do nothing more than repeat the same test
over and over again.

I guess that the suite() method throws a runtime exception when it
executes. Given how complex it is, there is no way for me to understand
what it's trying to do.

What is it that you're trying to do here? I am thoroughly confused.
